title: Support (measure theory)
summary: In mathematics, the support (sometimes topological support or spectrum) of a measure μ {\displaystyle \mu } on a measurable topological space ( X , Borel ⁡ ( X ) ) {\displaystyle (X,\operatorname {Borel} (X))} is a precise notion of where in the space X {\displaystyle X} the measure "lives". It is defined to be the largest (closed) subset of X {\displaystyle X} for which every open neighbourhood of every point of the set has positive measure.
